content.description:
Start 5 feet right of

Bolivian Freeze Job

and climb the steep slab until you can traverse right and finish on the final few moves of Chasin' the Grain. Thin and continuous.
content.protection: 2 to 4 inch cams, extendo rope for the TR anchor rig.

content.description:
Start up

Blue Sky, Black Death

and then follow a right-slanting crack to a horizontal and then lieback up a seam to finish in another crack.
content.location:
On the left side of the face between

Blue Sky, Black Death

/

Black Plague

and

Barn Door, Left

.

content.description:
Climbs face and seams on the smooth face right of

Chile Willie

.

A short, unmemorable route, on the (shorter) right side of the Rock Garden Valley. Starts on unprotected but easy face climbing for 15 feet, eventually getting to a broken crack system for the last half.
content.protection: A couple of small pieces, perhaps just a set of stoppers.
content.location:
Far right side of the shorter wall, just right of

Bolivian Freeze Job

.

content.description:
Climb partway up

Chile Willie

and then cut left to climb the steep friction face between that route and

Bolivian Freeze Job

.

Face climb up to a small roof/overlap and clip the first of three bolts which protect delicate face moves that lead into discontinuous cracks to finish. Large cams are needed to set an anchor.

An engaging route that if done in conjunction with the other routes nearby can provide a few hours or more of enjoyment. Morning sun and afternoon shade.
content.protection: 3 bolts (3/8"), gear to 2.5" (need pro to 4" for anchor)
content.location:
This is the route just left of

Amber Waves of Grain

and starts from the center of the ledge which runs along the base of the wall.

content.description:
The climb is a somewhat tricky to protect thin crack on the extreme right-hand portion of the wall, and starts off the right end of a nice, flat ledge.

Although not on par with the more popular left-end routes, this route and it's neighbors provide fun climbing with a short, easy approach and far less traffic.
content.location: Scramble up the approach gully to where it levels out, break right and then double back somewhat to access this portion of the wall, the less popular right side of the Rock Garden Valley Wall.

content.description:
Face climb up and then right angling towards and close to

Barn Door, Left

. Grainy and somewhat unpleasant - minus one star out of five.
content.location:
On the right side of the face between

Black Plague

and

Barn Door, Left

.

content.description:
Climbs a crack to arete right of

Grainspotting

.

Climb a short section of crack to friction face past three bolts and finish in a finger/hand crack.

Another fun mixed route on this less-visited portion of the Rock Garden Valley.
content.protection: 3 bolts (3/8"), gear to 2.5 inches (gear to 4 inches needed for anchor)
content.location:
Start 15 feet left of

Born in a Barn

, from the left edge of a ledge system that runs along the base of the wall.

content.description:
Climb a distinct right-slanting crack system that pinches down midway, where a bolt protects fun lieback moves into a flared section of crack to finish.

Another fun route for the less-visited right side of the Rock Garden Valley. Morning sun/afternoon shade.
content.location:
This route lies 15' left of

Barn Dance

and  starts off stacked ledges left of that route.

climbs.name: Barn Dance
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Karen Roseme, September 1998

content.description:
A start in a short crack leads up and left past a hole in the rock, above which a bolt leads into another section of crack, which dies out higher where a second bolt protects face moves into a finishing crack.

An interesting blend of intermittent crack and face climbing that will be enjoyed by those who like that sort of thing. Morning sun/afternoon shade.
content.protection: 2 bolts (3/8"), gear to 2.5 inches; to 4 inches for anchors)
content.location:
Located just left of

Barn Door, Right

.

climbs.name: Amber Waves of Grain
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Karen Roseme, September 1998

content.description:
Start off a large ledge that runs along the base of this portion of wall and climb well-protected steep smears on well-featured tan rock to a bolted anchor/rap station.

Good climbing, but unfortunately lacking the more appealing dark patina that's characteristic of the routes further up the canyon. A worthwhile route to get your balance and friction mind together on in relative safety.
content.location:
Located on the right side of the Rock Garden Wall, just left of

Bolivian Freeze Job

.
